column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: It has taken YEARS to find something that finally works for me.Expensive yes (with insurance $100.00) but I would pay the FULL amount. It has cleared my condition 100%. I use it once a day instead of twice and one can will easily last 2 months. I use a quarter size amount and it treats two fist size areas. It doesn't take a large amount to be effective!! Effectiveness and amount needed for treatment will vary from person to person I will agree...you just have to see what works best for you.

column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
lynnmooney, 65-74 Female  (Patient)
column9: Of all the prescription medications that I have tried for this condition, this is the only one that will clear up my breakout.  I do wish there was something over the counter that would work and was less expensive.

column2: deaflounder@yahoo.com, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: In 2005, I had a blue cross insurance that time and bought a olux foam that cost me $80.00. Now I don't have ins and it cost me $400.00.. I can't afford and don't know why it is very expensive. Where can I afford to pay? I really want olux so very bad because it worked out on my head so well. Any suggestions?

column2: philsyes, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've had scalp psoriasis for over 20 years. It ranged from mild flaking to severe. Tried every OTC ointment, cream, shampoo, etc with varying and inconsistent results. Olux-E cleared up the condition in less that a week. Started at twice daily as prescribed, then reduced to once every couple days. My Doctor provided a discount card with the Rx to reduce costs to $15 per refill. This is absolutely the best treatment for my condition. I wish it had been available for my Dad who suffered psoriasis (elbows, knees, hands, etc) for many many years for as far back as I can remember - he passed away 3 years ago at 83 years old.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: stopped itching related to exzema in 2 days

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have Haley Haley and this is the only drug that I found that clears this up.  I have had this for 15 years and it has been 15 years of agony.  Then I found this drug and it is excellent, even if it is expensive it is well worth it.

column2: tera, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Small less than dime sized patch on my shin about 4 years ago grew to encompass entire shin. Several doctors/several treatments - nothing worked. Olux-E cleared it up in less than 2 weeks. My daughter has eczema on back of thighs; not as much luck with that.

column2: R.Blair, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It has burned the hairs off my arms and chest.

column2: healthygirl, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Too damn expensive.  One can provided relief, but the product "ran out" after 5 days so I couldn't continue the treatment--consequently my itchy scalp returned.  I can't afford $220 every 5 days.  Who can?

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have bad exzema on th eback of my legs and my lower back area. This is the only medication that worked for me.

column2: workingmomindiana, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had psoriasis on my feet for 15 years. Have used Olux-E with Vertical ointment for 2 weeks now and have seen no improvement. Have been applying twice daily. Supposed to use for one more week. Disappointed.

column2: Paul, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I get coin shaped rash on my neck ,back and face, I apply this product 3 or 4 days in row and the rash disappears.

column2: gypsy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Some spots cleared up, but other broke out in new places. Eruption on back of scalp has never cleared up.It has been there for over 2 years. I lose pigment in affected area.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: The first two week treatment was highly effective. It cleared up nearly 90% of my psoriasis; however the following treatments have been less and less effective. In addition, I have been experiencing unusual muscle spasms in my upper back, shoulder, and neck region.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: used this medication for eczema that i've had for 5 years. very effective but dried out my skin.

column2: kquinn, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I've had itching and flaking in my ears for 15 years. It got so bad I could't put the phone to my ears.  Olux-E stopped the itching and cleared up 80% of it within a week of taking it.  I still need to use it two day in a row every two weeks.  I read some reviews that a side effect is adult acne.  I have had some acne, and I didn't know why. So, thank you for your comments.

column2: Kelly, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My dermatologist prescribed this for me for folliculitis on my legs. After the first application the intense itching went away. The product is very expensive ($220 retail), fortunately I have a prescription drug plan and my doc gave me a rebate card to get $25 off so the cost to me was only $25.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have had ezcema my entire life and this drug was the most effective I have used.

column2: cpamom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had ezcema on my hands for years and this definitely is the only product that has worked.  However, after a couple months of use, I developed adult acne and unwanted facial hair and it is terrible.  I have stopped using the OLUX for about a month now and the acne still has not gone away.  I guess it takes some time to get the medication out of my system.  I never had acne as a teenager and to start having it as an adult is so embarrassing!  So, beware of that side effect.

column2: oxford, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Definitely the most effective of the topical steroids I've used. Most effective when dispensed directly to plaques and left in place until foam breaks down and absorbs (20-30 minutes). In my case this product was used in conjunction with X-Trac laser treatments.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: It is so easy to use and works like a charm.  It releaves the itch and heals quickly.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been using this for a condition called Granuloma Annular for 3 weeks now and have not had any change.
